cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking generally northward across the northeastern Gulf of Mexico toward a landfall in the western Florida Panhandle, then forecast to move inland through Alabama-Georgia and into the southern Appalachians
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida Panhandle (near Panama City / Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Warning from Indian Pass FL to Yankeetown FL; Tropical Storm Warning from Navarre FL to the Wakulla/Jefferson County line FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch areas â€“ no hurricane warnings in force
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle and Big Bend, southeast Alabama, western Georgia, western Carolinas, and portions of the southeast U.S. interior
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (Cleveland not listed in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.rainfall: None expected; only minor remnant showers possible when system passes well south and east of Lake Erie
